AssociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to associate security groups with Tencent Cloud resources in batches.
AssociateSecurityGroups.name: Associates security groups in batches

CancelDcnJob.document: This API is used to cancel DCN synchronization.
CancelDcnJob.name: Cancels DCN synchronization

CloseDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to disable public network access for a TencentDB instance, which will make the public IP address inaccessible. The `DescribeDCDBInstances` API will not return the public domain name and port information of the corresponding instance.
CloseDBExtranetAccess.name: Disables public network access

CopyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to copy the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts. Permissions can only be copied between accounts with the same `Readonly` attribute.
CopyAccountPrivileges.name: Copies account permissions

CreateAccount.document: This API is used to create a TencentDB account. Multiple accounts can be created for one instance. Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
CreateAccount.name: Creates account

CreateHourDBInstance.document: This API is used to create pay-as-you-go instances.
CreateHourDBInstance.name: Creates pay-as-you-go instances

DeleteAccount.document: This API is used to delete a TencentDB account, which is uniquely identified by username and host.
DeleteAccount.name: Deletes account

DescribeDBInstances.document:
This API is used to query the TencentDB instance list. It supports filtering instances by project ID, instance ID, private address, and instance name.
If no filter is specified, 20 instances will be returned by default. Up to 100 instances can be returned for a single request.
DescribeDBInstances.name: Queries instance list

DescribeDBLogFiles.document: This API is used to get the list of various logs of a database, including cold backups, binlogs, errlogs, and slowlogs.
DescribeDBLogFiles.name: Gets log list

DescribeDBSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of an instance.
DescribeDBSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of an instance

DescribeDcnDetail.document: This API is used to query the disaster recovery details of an instance.
DescribeDcnDetail.name: Queries the disaster recovery details of an instance

DescribeFileDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to get the download URL of a specific backup or log file of a database.
DescribeFileDownloadUrl.name: Gets the backup/log download URL

DescribeInstanceNodeInfo.document: This API is used to query the information of primary and replica nodes of an instance.
DescribeInstanceNodeInfo.name: Queries instance node information

DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of a project.
DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of a project

DestroyHourDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate a pay-as-you-go instance.
DestroyHourDBInstance.name: Terminates a pay-as-you-go instance

DisassociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to unassociate security groups from instances in batches.
DisassociateSecurityGroups.name: Unassociates security groups in batches

GrantAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to grant permissions to a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
GrantAccountPrivileges.name: Sets account permissions

ModifyAccountDescription.document:
This API is used to modify the remarks of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ModifyAccountDescription.name: Modifies account remarks

ModifyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to modify the permissions of a TencentDB instance account.

**Notes**
- Only the SELECT permission (that is, set the permission parameter to `["SELECT"]`) of the system database `mysql` can be granted.
- An error will be reported if read-write permissions are granted to a read-only account.
- If the parameter of permissions at a level is left empty, no change will be made to the permissions at the level that have been granted. To clear granted permissions at a level, set `GlobalPrivileges.N` or `Privileges` to an empty array.
ModifyAccountPrivileges.name: Modifies the permissions of a TencentDB instance account

ModifyDBInstancesProject.document: This API is used to modify the project to which TencentDB instances belong.
ModifyDBInstancesProject.name: Modifies the project to which instances belong

ModifySyncTaskAttribute.document: This API is used to modify sync task attributes (currently, only the task name can be modified).
ModifySyncTaskAttribute.name: Modifies sync task attributes

ResetAccountPassword.document:
This API is used to reset the password of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ResetAccountPassword.name: Resets account password

members.name: Password

members.document: Whether to create a read-only account. 0: no; 1: for the account's SQL requests, the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the primary will be used; 2: the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the operation will fail.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document: Account remarks, which can contain 0-256 letters, digits, and common symbols.

If this parameter is left empty, `10.1.9` will be used.

Order ID, which is used for calling the `DescribeOrders` API.
 The parameter can be used to either query order details or call the user account APIs to make another payment when this payment fails.
members.name: DealName

members.document:
IDs of the instances you have purchased in this order. If no instance IDs are returned, you can query them with the `DescribeOrders` API. You can also use the `DescribeDBInstances` API to check whether an instance has been created successfully.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: Instance ID, which is in the format of `tdsql-ow728lmc` and can be obtained through the `DescribeDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Login username.

members.document: Access host allowed for user. An account is uniquely identified by username and host.
members.name: Host

members.document: Database name. `\*` indicates that global permissions will be set (i.e., `\*.\*`), in which case the `Type` and `Object ` parameters will be ignored. If `DbName` is not `\*`, the input parameter `Type` is required.
members.name: DbName

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES`, `LOCK TABLES`, `EXECUTE`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `CREATE ROUTINE`, `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EVENT`, `TRIGGER`, `SHOW DATABASES`, `REPLICATION CLIENT`, `REPLICATION SLAVE`. 
Database permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES`, `LOCK TABLES`, `EXECUTE`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `CREATE ROUTINE`, `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EVENT`, `TRIGGER`. 
Table/View permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`. 
Stored procedure/function permission. Valid values: `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EXECUTE`. 
Field permission. Valid values: `INSERT`, `REFERENCES`, `SELECT`, `UPDATE`.
members.name: Privileges

members.document: Type. Valid values: table, view, proc, func, \*. If `DbName` is a specific database name and `Type` is `\*`, the permissions of the database will be set (i.e., `db.\*`), in which case the `Object` parameter will be ignored
members.name: Type

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is `table`, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty
members.name: Object

members.document: If `Type` is `table` and `ColName` is `\*`, the permissions will be granted to the table; if `ColName` is a specific field name, the permissions will be granted to the field
members.name: ColName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Last modified time of log
members.name: Mtime

members.document: File length
members.name: Length

members.document: Uniform resource identifier (URI) used during log download
members.name: Uri

members.document: Filename
members.name: FileName

members.document: Instance ID, which is in the format of `tdsql-ow728lmc` and can be obtained through the `DescribeDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Login username.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Access host allowed for user. An account is uniquely identified by username and host.
members.name: Host

members.document: New account remarks, which can contain 0-256 characters.
members.name: Description

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Instance ID in the format of tdsql-c1nl9rpv. It is the same as the instance ID displayed in the TencentDB console.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Database account, including username and host address.
members.name: Accounts

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values of `GlobalPrivileges`: `"SELECT"`, `"INSERT"`, `"UPDATE"`, `"DELETE"`, `"CREATE"`, `"PROCESS"`, `"DROP"`, `"REFERENCES"`, `"INDEX"`, `"ALTER"`, `"SHOW DATABASES"`, `"CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES"`, `"LOCK TABLES"`, `"EXECUTE"`, `"CREATE VIEW"`, `"SHOW VIEW"`, `"CREATE ROUTINE"`, `"ALTER ROUTINE"`, `"EVENT"`, `"TRIGGER"`.
Note: if the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted global permissions. To clear the granted global permissions, set the parameter to an empty array.
members.name: GlobalPrivileges

members.document:
Database permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `"SELECT"`, `"INSERT"`, `"UPDATE"`, `"DELETE"`, `"CREATE"`, `"DROP"`, `"REFERENCES"`, `"INDEX"`, `"ALTER"`, `"CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES"`, `"LOCK TABLES"`, `"EXECUTE"`, `"CREATE VIEW"`, `"SHOW VIEW"`, `"CREATE ROUTINE"`, `"ALTER ROUTINE"`, `"EVENT"`, `"TRIGGER"`.
Note: if the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted database permissions. To clear the granted database permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: DatabasePrivileges

members.document:
Database table permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted table permissions. To clear the granted table permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: TablePrivileges

members.document:
Column permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `"SELECT"`, `"INSERT"`, `"UPDATE"`, `"REFERENCES"`.
Note: if the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted column permissions. To clear the granted column permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ColumnPrivileges

members.document:
Database view permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted view permissions. To clear the granted view permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ViewPrivileges

members.document:
Database function permissions. Valid values of `Privileges`: `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EXECUTE`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted function permissions. To clear the granted function permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: FunctionPrivileges

members.document:
Database stored procedure permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EXECUTE`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted stored procedure permissions. To clear the granted stored procedure permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ProcedurePrivileges

members.document: Async task ID, which can be used in the [DescribeFlow](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/237/16177?from_cn_redirect=1) API to query the async task result.
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: List of IDs of instances to be modified. The ID is in the format of `tdsql-ow728lmc` and can be obtained through the `DescribeDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: ID of the project to be assigned, which can be obtained through the `DescribeProjects` API.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: IDs of tasks for which to modify the attributes. The IDs can be obtained by the return value of the `DescribeSyncTasks` API. Up to 100 tasks can be operated at a time.
members.name: TaskIds

members.document: Task name. You can specify any name you like, but its length cannot exceed 100 characters.
members.name: TaskName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.name: NodeId

members.name: Role

members.name: Database
